name: Liang Zhao 0002
content: Dr. Liang Zhao â AI Researcher About Me I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science at Emory University. I obtained Ph.D. degree as an Outstanding Doctoral Student in the Department of Computer Science at Virginia Tech in 2017. My research spans machine learning and artificial intelligence for complex data including networks, spatial, temporal, and textual data. I have authored over two hundred papers in top-tier venues such as KDD, NeurIPS, ICLR, AAAI, and IJCAI. Our research is generously supported by federal agencies such as NSF (CAREER, III, IIBR, CRII, IUCRC, etc.), NIH, and industrial sponsors such as Amazon, Meta, Merck, NVidia, Cisco, NEC Lab, Oracle, and Bank of America. GraphRAG: LLMs for Networked Documents [GRAG][CG-RAG] Foundation models for geospatial reasoning [Spatial-RAG] Explanation-guided Learning [2D images, 3D images, texts, graphs, spatiotemporal] Geometric Shape Representation Learning [Spatial networks, periodic graphs, trajectories, polygon, polyhedron, geometric trees] Graph Neural Networks for Network Science [Influence Maximization, Source Localization, Network Interdiction] Accelerating Large Language Models [SparseLLM, FedSpaLLM, SpeedupLLM] News&Highlights (11/25) Our paper on Transferrable Deep Clustering has won CIKM 2025 Best Paper Runner-up Award! (08/25) Our paper on EMBERS societal event forecasting system has won KDD 2025 Test of Time Award! (06/25) Our LabBot is online, feel free to chat and know us better! (05/25) Our LLM Domain Specialization paper has been accepted by CSUR (IF: 23.2)! (05/25) Three papers in KDD 2025 and one paper in ACL 2025 (04/25) Will give a tutorial in IJCAI 2025 on Advances of RAG (03/25) Will give an invited talk in Oak Ridge National Laboratory (03/25) Will give an invited talk in INFORMS 2025 (01/25) Will serve as Area Chairs of NeurIPS'25, ICML'25, and ICLR'25 Our work can give concise textual explanations on graph predictions, see our ACL'25 paper: GraphNarrator We discovered that LLM reasoning can become faster while using, check our recent investigation: Can Practice Make LLM Reasoning Faster? We debuted the RAG for spatial databases: Spatial-RAG: Spatial Retrieval Augmented Generation for Real-World Spatial Reasoning Questions Our survey paper Domain Specialization as the Key to Make Large Language Models Disruptive: A Comprehensive Survey has been cited by Economic Report of the President of the U.S. Our survey paper about LLM efficiency: Beyond Efficiency: A Systematic Survey of Resource-Efficient Large Language Models Selected Publications (Full list in Google Scholar) 2026 TKDD Xieojie Guo, Yuanqi Du, Zheng Zhang, and Liang Zhao. Efficient Deep Generative Models for Spatial Networks via Spanning Tree Sampler. Transactions on Knowledge Discovery from Data (TKDD), accepted, to appear.
